alert.note: Alert for Chaffee; Saguache (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 03 at 6:26PM MDT until August 03 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CHAFFEE AND NORTHEASTERN SAGUACHE COUNTIES... At 626 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms that were producing heavy rain across the warned area have weakened, but light rain may still be ongoing. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bonanza and Poncha Pass. This includes the following high risk locations... Highway 285 south of Poncha Springs to Poncha Pass. This includes the following streams and drainages... South Arkansas River, Starvation Creek, Beaver Creek, Brewery Creek, Kerber Creek, Poncha Creek, Silver Creek, San Luis Creek, Spring Creek, Droz Creek and Little Cochetopa Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
